reviews.text: Excelente restaurante, uno de mis favoritos en Nueva York. La comida, el servicio y el ambiente fueron espectaculares. Lo recomiendo al 100%, la pasamos genial. Â¡Muchas gracias al equipo de Nobu Downtown! ğŸ£âœ¨

Deliciosa comida, gran variedad y estilo.
Una experiencia de sabores y aromas pero ten preparada la cartera $$$.
What an amazing experience! Service, food, music - loved every minute of it! Would definitely come back!
å¤ªå–œæ¬¢Nobu
A place that I haven't been to in 10 years and still as great as it was back then. Absolutely fabulous

My experience at Nobu Downtown was absolutely amazing. The service was impeccableâ€”attentive, professional, and perfectly timed. I tried the tasting menu, and it was truly worth it. Every dish was beautifully presented and bursting with flavor. From start to finish, everything was delicious. Highly recommend for a special night out in New York!

Came here to celebrate an anniversary dinner in the middle of the week. Surprisingly it was not as busy as I was expecting at 6:30pm. Food quality and taste was ok, but presentation was amazing. Seating was ample in the lower level. Service was good but I could tell they were short staffed based on the wait times.

In terms of menu items, I would recommend the crispy rice and the specialty roles.
Very cool space among the columns. Food is very good. Literally everything we ordered was outstanding, even things that would be basic somewhere else were elevated here.

Iâ€™ve been a loyal patron of Nobu Downtown since 2021 and have always appreciated the exceptional service and atmosphere that make it such a standout dining experience. However, my recent visit at 5:30 PM with a party of five was nothing short of disappointing.

Upon arrival, we were met at the front by a gentleman who was immediately dismissive and rude. Without any effort to accommodate or welcome us, he told us we could "crowd around the bar." The tone and delivery were unnecessarily dismissive, a stark contrast to the hospitality Iâ€™ve come to expect at Nobu.

Things unfortunately didnâ€™t improve. He later walked past our table and gave us a pointed, unfriendly look, which felt like a deliberate mean mug. When one of our guests politely asked where the restroom was, he responded with clear irritation, even rolling his eyes. As we were leaving, he gave me a long, passive aggressive stare that felt both unprofessional and uncalled for.

Iâ€™ve never encountered this kind of behavior in all my years of frequenting Nobu, and it truly makes me reconsider returning. I'm not sure where this individual's energy came from this evening, but his demeanor and approach are entirely misaligned with the Nobu standard of experience.

Anniversary dinner, server was awkward and not friendly.  Ordered the chefs set menuâ€¦.dishes were rapid fireâ€¦we asked for a  short break between the 3rd and 4thâ€¦ curtly told we were on a short timeframe to turn the tables.   Lost interest in the food, server and Nobu from that point on.  We boxed up the remaining dishes and left.  Had the server explained the tight timeframe and oversized portions we could have made an informed decision.  The attitude of the place really rubs against what the kitchen tries really hard to deliverâ€¦ disappointing!

In town for a week, this was the worst of 7 dinners (and the most expensive). Honestly, the sushi in the strip mall back home was better. WAY overpriced for the quality. We had 4 sushi rolls, the best one was mediocre at best. The edamame was not as good as the frozen bag from the grocery store. Our server obviously didnâ€™t want to be there. A note for others, was offered â€œstill or sparklingâ€ water when we sat, seemed like a setup to make another $9/bottle from us, as â€œtapâ€ wasnâ€™t initially offered. Just seemed like they are cashing in on the Nobu name, not delivering a great meal. Go elsewhere, we had 6 other GREAT meals, this was noticeably below those.

Every single dish we got was so good!! Fresh fish with yummy sauces. We asked for recommendations and our server suggested 2 specials which were both so ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ chutoro with truffleâ€¦ salmon with japanese pearâ€¦ and their signature miso cod. Worth the price! Will def be back!

Took a client and client here for dinner.  Had a table at the bar and it did not disappoint.   We did the omakase and it was awesome.  Plenty of food and a great way to sample the best chef selections.  Great experience and will be back.   I have been to other Nobu locations and they are all good.  This location was great.   Will be back.
Not easy to get in but the overall experience was just awesome

Awesome service, excellent food in general and spacious atmosphere. Otoro sushi was the best. Scallop sushi, Snapper sushi and Wagyu sushi were really good. Sushi and sashimi were very fresh. Tuna off the bone was good. Cod was delicious. Squid was tasty and not chewy. Lobster was a little over battered so it became a little soggy.

This restaurant anywhere in the world will always be my favorite. I love it with all my heart. The service is spectacular. It was my first time at this location and itâ€™s beautiful and very modern. The bar/lounge area is excellent; the bartenders are super attentive, and itâ€™s perfect for a date night or a few drinks with friends. Downstairs youâ€™ll find the modern, open-concept dining room. This location keeps the same high standards as the others in both service and food. 100% recommended.
My favorite Japanese spot  the food is always fresh & delicious, the service is excellent, and the drinks never disappoint.
Excellent omakase, would definitely recommend.

I really miss old Nobu in Tribeca. The sashimi salad with Matushisa dressing used to be a rather grand looking family style dish, but it has shrunk to a sad and unremarkable size. I asked the server which dishes are served with yamamomo Japanese mountain peaches and she informed that she wasn't aware of them served anymore. The dessert bento boxes used to have more than just 2 items. The place was so empty on a Friday night! It was my friend's first time trying Nobu and felt that although all the food was very good, it wasn't too different from that which is served at places like Buddakhan and Zuma. I informed that Nobu predated them and used to be better. Hope things turn around.

Starting off the interior design was beautiful!! The upstairs bar era was extremely well designed with an upscale and luxury yet cozy atmosphereâ€”really great for a casual bite and drinks. But I will say the host upstairs wasnâ€™t the friendliest so I took a star away.

Moving down to the main dining room; as per the interior design upstairs being beautiful, it was beautiful downstairs as well.

We had the MOST amazing server ever named Esteban!! He remembered us from 2 months ago which was very sweet!

The service was very attentive even though it was a very busy night with a private event going on. All the water cups were refilled, the tables were all crumbed very neat, plates were changed every course, and everything came out very promptly.

The food was also absolutely delicious! I highly recommend the miso cod which just absolutely melts in your mouth as well as the buttery scallop sashimi.

I have been coming to Nobu every week and it truly never disappoints!

New review September 2025

Sorry, Nobu, I have to lower my rating again. The lunch portions are now very smallâ€”about one-third of what they were at the beginning of September. The service remains poor. I will not return until there are real improvements.

Review September 2025: 4 stars

Thereâ€™s a new lunch prix fixe menuâ€”$45 for a three-course mealâ€”and itâ€™s excellent. The service has also improved.
Thank you!!!!

Old review 2024: 2 stars
The service is terrible. A high-end restaurant should provide much better service. On two separate occasions, a group of three people was served at different times. Additionally, the rice never arrived.
Not easy to get in but thank you for making my wish my come true.

What was innovative 20 years ago now is heavy handed over seasoning (e.g. new style wagyu). Restaurant scene has evolved. Decor and service are great, other places will have better food, particularly at this price point. Upstairs music was a little clubby for business.

Literally probably one of the BEST restaurants Iâ€™ve ever been to, experience to food. The food was absolutely amazing! I had the Salmon teriyaki and a sushi hand along with dessert which was just overall amazing! They have quick service, the waitresses and waiters are all so kind and accommodating. I have nothing bad to say about Nobu, 10/10 would recommend!
Wanloe, Eriko was such an amazing server and gave us great recommendations! She was warm and attentive and so kind! Please give her a raise and all the appreciation she so deserves!

We had a wonderful experience here. For mains we ordered the wagyu steak, spicy shrimp, and creamy crab - all were cooked perfectly and full of flavor. The service was attentive and friendly, which really added to the evening. The atmosphere was warm and inviting, making it a great place to enjoy a night out..

We paid $400 and left hungry, confused and disappointed.

Our food came one at a time so we ate our entrees separately. Our nigiri took 50 minutes to come and for those who don't know Nigiri is literally raw fish.

Im so sick of these places and the people who casually write 5 star reviews because they never ate anything good in their life. I've also never tasted such mediocre sushi rolls in my life. Im not mad about the money because that's a days work for me. I'm mad that other people are going to fall into this trap restaurant and I couldn't stop them.

After we left we went to the chick Fila and just got a pretzel chicken sandwich which was way more impressive for 3% the cost.

Edit: after checking their website they literally pay their workers minimum wage. This restaurant is awful.
The food is always tasty/delicious. The server could have been better.
Perfect place for a date night!!! I've been to multiple Nobus in the world and this is one of my fav!

Recently had a wonderful dining experience at Nobu. The food was fresh and full of flavor, and everything we tried was well prepared. Our server Tiffany made the night even better. She was attentive throughout the night, knew the menu inside and out, and gave us thoughtful suggestions that made the meal even better. Her service added so much to the experience and we left very happy.
no respect
Tasting menu is a must have! Best dessert ğŸ¨ I ever had and I am not a dessert person at all.

I always have the best time when I come here.  The bar opens at 5 and dinner is at 5:30.  The bar is literally that but then they have side tables that you can sit at.  Libations were,  Nobu Sidecar, citrusy and good.  Pina Martini, if you like sweet & Matsushia Martini, refreshingly cucumbers.  Crispy rice tuna to start and the the Summer Omakse, samples of a few dishes, well worth it.  Our waiter was very informative and we were very happy with our choices.  Have to make it to midtown one as well.
this was amazing

I want to Preface this review by saying the customer service upstairs (bar area) was nothing short of top notch!
As far as the restaurant area (downstairs) our experience was rather unpleasant. We were seated for 10 minutes before the waiter KEVIN decided to show up . He never greeted us and tried to avoid coming over for 10 mins while talking to other patrons . Once at our table he stated â€œyou have questions?â€ My Finance and I looked up to see him standing off to the side . We tried to inquire about several dishes he had no interest in explaining , rushed us actually to order. And when we asked for a specific sauce he insulted us with a sarcastic response. My food came out first I practically finished my food before my finances food arrived he never came back to check on us. Fast forward a couple sat right behind us at 930pm Kevin showed up at 932 greeted said couple annoyed the specials even told them his favorites to top it off he suggested he will talk to the chef on his behalf. It was just very disturbing. Needless to say we were the only Black couple in the section . Itâ€™s just very sad in todayâ€™s society that these people are allowed to work in customer service positions without consequences for their actions. We are regulars at the other Nobu locations and expected top notch service at the Downtown restaurant. We will not be returning and will definitely spread the word about the blatant racial discrimination from Kevin.
Chic atmosphere, standout miso black cod.
Will be back. Always a pleasure
Absolutely worth the money. Everything was extremely mouthwatering and delicious! If only I didn't live so far away and could come back sooner!
Iâ€™m on a Nobu World Tour right now & this was my 4th stop. I came here just for drinks. The drink I ordered was really good. The service was great too. Nice ambiance inside.

Nobu has come to define the fine dining experience in Japanese cuisine, and its use of innovation in combining flavors continues to raise the bar.

Our experience was largely positive, except for slightly sluggish service and some forgettable dishes (vegetable sushi and veggie tempura to name a few).

Apart from that, the service was hospitable, and food and drinks were great, and the ambience was exceptional.

Overall, i enjoyed my visit to Nobu and look forward to being back again!

Update: dropped by for lunch and everything was delicious and so efficient!
Thank you Nobu for the amazing dinner! Food is the best here, and the service is always top!

Truly a 5-star experience all around. I can't lie, this is THE fanciest restaurant I've ever been to in my life. Nevertheless, they absolutely delivered. I never thought I'd spend $250 on a meal and feel like I got a good value! But let me tell you, Nobu was worth it!

The service is unbelievable aswell as the atmosphere. The food was bland and not worth the price The black miso cod tasted so sweet it was hard to appreciate any of the other flavors in the dish. The spicy tuna had no flavor.
But the sushi was Fantastic I would stick with the sushi here Personallt in the future. Also get a drink the old fashioned was very good and had a custom Nobu ice cube that was pretty cool.
Excelente restaurante en new York. Gran opciÃ³n para cena de trabajo/negocios. Variada carta de vinos y excelente opciones vegetarianas.
Great food and service even though it was a bit pricey. They gave us free dessert though ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹ğŸ˜‹

We tried the summer tasting menu with wine pairing. The second sashimi course was impressive. The rest is just ok. In the sushi course, the shrimp is overcooked. very chewy. not a good idea. The rest two courses, the protein was cooked perfectly but the sauce was way too salty. We did not want to have caffeinated desserts late in the day. They replaced the dessert with a browny. Boy, is that thing sweet. And, to make things even worse, they paired it with a sweet wine. Can you have a backup plan for people who do not sleep well? I suspect they just pulled the browny out of the fridge. A honeydew melon would be more appropriate. Overall, the menu ison the heavy side for the season.

We paid $50 per person for sushi and got it cold, even though it was supposed to be in tempura. Everything tasted like it had been prepared earlier and taken straight out of the fridge. Iâ€™m disappointed because Iâ€™ve had much cheaper sushi that was so much better! Shocking and unbelievable. I donâ€™t recommend it.

Amazing food.
Attentive service.
Not sure what lead to mixed reviews for this location.

Tasting menu not worth it. We had a late night reservation and the chef decided to skip a course. Not that we mind cause we were full, but they should have informed us beforehand. The food itself was okay. I was comparing it with the many Michelin tasting menus around the world, so that's why it was a let down.

Atmosphere is nice and it feels like a nice, premium fine dining place. Would recommend it to influencers but would not recommend it to food critics.

ì•ˆì‹¬ ìƒŒë“œìœ„ì¹˜ì™€ ìƒˆìš° ìš”ë¦¬ê°€ ë§›ìˆê³  ì–‘ë„ ë§ì•˜ìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. í›„ì‹ë„ ì†ì— ê¼½ì„ ì •ë„ë¡œ í›Œë¥­í–ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤. ìœ„ìŠ¤í‚¤ ì¹´í‘¸ì¹˜ë…¸ì™€ ë¸Œë¼ìš°ë‹ˆê°€ êµ‰ì¥íˆ ì•„ë¦„ë‹µê²Œ í”Œë ˆì´íŒ…ë˜ì—ˆê³  ë¬´ì²™ ë§›ìˆì—ˆìŠµë‹ˆë‹¤.

Interior is lovely, service was very friendly! We managed to get a table walking in on a Sunday, and it wasnâ€™t too busy downstairs so wasnâ€™t too loud either.

Food was good, especially the honey truffle corn and crispy rice! Tacos are small, but tasty. Baked Alaska dessert was surprisingly good, although flambÃ© did char one side a little too much!

Expected the food to be better considering the price point but okay for a nice evening out.

All I can say is just WOW. I loved the ambiance and the interior design of the restaurant. Great place to have a date or for a celebration.

I had the pleasure of having June as our waitress and she was superb. She gave us more insight in the flavor profiles and some recommendations. Her service was great and I would come back just to have her take care of everything.

Now for the food, I loved everything except the shittake salad but thatâ€™s only because of a texture sensitivity I have, the lemon dressing in the salad was great. The edamame choclo is the best edamame Iâ€™ve had, it was spicy and the Peruvian corn it comes with complements the dish so well. I loved the crispy rice with the spicy tuna, the crispy rice is so buttery and the spicy tuna on top was amazing. The rock shrimp was delicious and fresh. The yellowtail and jalapeÃ±o was a great burst of freshness with the spice of the jalapeÃ±o had my tastebuds dancing. The wagyu dumpling were soooo filling and delicious, I want to try the tacos next time.

June also got me and my partner a small bite with some writing to congratulate on our anniversary which was so kind!!! (We couldnâ€™t order dessert because we were SO full but the passion fruit baked Alaska looked soooo good from what I saw other guests)

Everything was delicious and I understand the hype now.

Fun experience! I celebrated my birthday , food was delicious! Service was soooo fast and efficient and organized!  Presentation is beautiful! I would say the menu was dirty and dirty page of sauce inside , chair was crooked . Overall we enjoyed coming there , staff was friendly and nice

What a beautiful classy designed restaurant with an excellent service! The bento lunch box was a great deal and absolutely delicious.  My lunch box contained 3 pieces of sushi, a salmon avacado roll, seared tuna salad, sauteed vegetables with a hint of spiciness, creamy rock shrimp tempura and a rich miso glazed over grill cod.  The green tea set was a delight with a hint of dew.  Going to shopping now around the area after this heavenly lunch ğŸ˜‹
Loved everything! Yellowtail Jalapeno is bomb! Definitely try. So are the Tacos and sashimi. Oysters were great too.

Nobu was great. The entrance was a little confusing but i found it. The time listed when itâ€™s closed is actually the time they stop taking customers because i went on a Friday at 10:30pm and google/apple maps says it â€œclosesâ€ at 10:45pm. The food comes in small portions so u can try many appetizers if you want. The drinks were great and the server was so friendly and helpful to us.

Beautiful location and great ambiance! However, limited menu, mediocre food, and high price points. The $10 tacos are too small for the price and bland taste. The lobster tempura was extremely tough to chew to a point that I wasnâ€™t comfortable swallowing it (but the combination of jalapeÃ±o , cilantro, and, sauce was good) and the chicken satay was just ok, no fireworks. In addition to this factors my husband couldnâ€™t eat anything on the menu because he had a soy allergy. Nobu may be for you but not for us

Definitely not the Nobu that opened up in Tribeca so many years ago which changed dining.  This restaurant claims to be where the old restaurant moved but doesnâ€™t feel like it at all. The sashimi salad which was what made them famous was extremely stingy and overly salty, the wagu dumplings way too rich. The black cod was excellent but very stingy on the sauce. The atmosphere was very strange, like a Japanese Cheesecake Factory.  Should have eaten upstairs.

Shared a meal here with 4 friends and enjoyed a diverse spread of maki and sushimi rolls. The cocktails were unique and tasteful and the server was able to make suitable recommendations based on everyone's personal preferences. The dessert was actually our favourite part of the meal! Great ambience and open concept design - good for those looking to take some nice photos with friends for a night out. Thanks for hosting us!
King crab 10/10 crispy rice w spicy tuna 1000/10 yellow tail fresh. French 75 amazing. Donâ€™t get the Brussels sprouts were bitter yuck

I fell in love with the drinks here! I had to get at least 5. The food was good as well but they were small portions. Everything was very tasty and had its unique appeal. The caviar was so tasty with the Guacamole! This place was worth its hype for sure. The service was amazing, got treated so well that it felt like the servers were my friends haha. Such a good time and great place.

Fantastic food and wonderful service in a gorgeous setting  ğŸ˜ I always enjoy visiting the different Nobu locations and though sitting in the dining room looking for celebrities is fun, I love sitting at the bar. And Nobu Downtown has a beautiful bar and lounge area! It's a perfect place to sip and snack while catching up with friends ğŸ’š
Sushi ğŸ£ is like any other place pretty unremarkable for the price we paid ! The restaurant vibe is link a chain restaurant â€œ Chilliâ€™s â€œ feel!

Nice to try once but is very over priced and itâ€™s usually very packed so it doesnâ€™t feel intimate or really upscale, I was almost dining with the people next to us from how close the tables were. The service is quick but nothing memorable and the food was as good as it gets

DAS Nobu. Macht seinem Namen Ehre. Essen war auÃŸergewÃ¶hnlich, vielfÃ¤ltig. Wir waren als Gruppe zu acht vor Ort mit Kindern. Alles prima. Einzig beim Service leider etwas Abstriche, unser Mann hatte leider nicht seinen besten Tag. Gerne wieder.

Truly lives up to their reputation, a quality dining experience! I was impressed with every dish, every bite was my favorite bite. Impeccable service. Low lighting ambiance really sets the mood if youâ€™re planning to come for date night.

I have been meaning to try Nobu out for a while and tonight was that night.  It's a beautiful spot for a date night or special occasion.  The food was solid, the cocktails were amazing, and the service was quite good.

Nobu Sidecar (fantastic cocktail)

-Toro Nigiri (amazing.  One of my favorite bites of the night)

-Unagi Nigiri (very good.  Melts in your mouth)

-Yellowtail w/ jalapeÃ±o & cilantro (although it had some kick to it and the cilantro flavor was pronounced, it is a very good dish)

-Crispy Rice w/ Spicy tuna (spicy tuna spread was great.  The crispy rice cubes were ok.   I personally think this appetizer is skippable)

-Shishito Peppers w/ sea salt (solid appetizer.   I'd love them blistered a bit more but they were still solid)

Nobu Tacos (Tuna & Salmon.  These were the perfect bites.  The salmon ones were my preferred option)

Scallops with spicy garlic (super flavorful!!! Just needs some rice or something to sop up the sauce)

Black Miso Cod (solid piece of fish. BADLY needs more of the sauce, instead of the 4 dots they give you.  Also does not come with a side of rice or veggies.  Just the piece of fish.)

Soba-cha Brownie (a solid dessert option.  Felt rich but light at the same time.  I'd get it again)

Overall. My experience at Nobu was nice.  The food was quite good (with some room for minor improvements). The cocktails were the stars of the show.  Thank you!
The food was incredible, the fish was high quality, and everything was made to perfection!

Food tasted great (except the wagyu dumplings but my friend thought they were amazing) but the portions are so small. Feels like snacks almost. Fish is comparable to other sushi spots. Expected fish to be better because of the hype. Still good though, except the wagyu tbh. Toro was great! The tuna tartar as well. Yellow tail was great. Eggplant great. Miso soup great. Just wanted bigger portions but I guess you pay for the atmosphere, which was also comparable to other spots

I had a wonderful experience at Nobu Downtown. The food was phenomenal, the atmosphere great, and the service was some of the best Iâ€™ve had in a while. My wife and I were unsure what to order with so many great options on the menu, but our server guided us through it and was extremely helpful. We ended up having the yellowtail jalapeÃ±o, the crispy rise with tuna, toro and scallion sushi roll, shrimp and lobster with spicy lemon sauce, and black cod with miso. We also had the buttermilk doughnuts for dessert. Not a single one of the courses we had disappointed. We will definitely be back soon! Would highly recommend.

Came here and got lucky to sit at the sushi bar. I got two rolls of the vegetable sushi and tofu new style. Tofu new style was so bad. Just no. The vegetable sushi was so good. It was so fresh. I also got the donuts also very good. The lychee martini was delicious as well. Service was good but a bit slow. The interior is beautiful as well. Such a nice time.

This was my first time back since 2021 and I really enjoyed it. Our server was great and brought everything out in the right order. We got a mix of hot and cold dishes, everything was yummy
- I highly recommend the wagu soup dumplings and the Brussel sprouts

If youâ€™re looking to try new food, Nobu is the place for it. I loved the atmosphere and the bartenders were excellent. I felt very welcomed and comfortable in the space.
I ordered the waygu dumplings and cod lettuce wraps. The portions are small but the dishes are very flavorful.

We had a wonderful experience at Nobu downtown! The food was delicious, and the staff was very friendly. My favorites were the black cod miso and crispy rice with tuna. The sushi was fresh and delicious. Overall, I enjoyed my dining experience here and highly recommend it!

Nobu hardly needs an introduction. As always, the sushi was outstanding. I recently attended their Christmas brunch, and I was thoroughly impressedâ€”despite being an all-you-can-eat offering, the taste and quality were absolutely top-notch.

Quality dining experience! Another great meal at Nobu! I love the â€œfamily styleâ€ or encouraged sharing nature of their menu. This way diners have the opportunity to share and try multiple things on the menu (because everything is amazing) The staff are all so energetic and emphasize on the happiness of the customer. The lowlight atmosphere gives it an elegant vibe adding to the overall experience. The crispy rice with spicy tuna and lobster tacos are my absolute favorite dishes!

interesting cold dishes. The sushi plates were okay. the espresso martini âœ¨ was so yummy.
The service was great - the only issue I noticed is they seemed rushing my group to finish meals quickly by asking to finish food to take the plates. Everyone in the group felt so rushed.
it's been the second time I tried Nobu. I think I prefer this spot more than the other location in the city (5th Avenue) I tried though.

Es war ein sehr schÃ¶nes Erlebnis. Das Essen war erstklassig und etwas besonderes. Der Black Cod war der Wahnsinn. Und die Nachspeisen sollte man nicht auslassen.
Das Ambiente war gut. Es war sehr gut besucht und ich gemischtes Publikum. Sehr lebhaft aber nicht unangenehm laut.
Der Service war sehr aufmerksam und schnell. Lediglich den Empfang hÃ¤tte ich mir etwas freundlicher vorgestellt und dass man uns zum Warten an die Bar fÃ¼hrt und nicht einfach alleine lÃ¤sst, ohne klare Anweisungen.
